titleStmt.title: Stimluus [sic] orthodoxus, sive Goadus redivivus A disputation partly thological, partly metaphysical, concerning the necessity and contingency of events in the world, in respect of Gods eternal decree. Written above twenty years since by that reverend and learned divine, Thomas Goad, doctor of divinity, and rector of Hadleigh in Suffolk.
titleStmt.author: Goad, Thomas, 1576-1638.

titleStmt.title: Stimluus [sic] orthodoxus, sive Goadus redivivus A disputation partly thological, partly metaphysical, concerning the necessity and contingency of events in the world, in respect of Gods eternal decree. Written above twenty years since by that reverend and learned divine, Thomas Goad, doctor of divinity, and rector of Hadleigh in Suffolk.
titleStmt.author: Goad, Thomas, 1576-1638.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for William Leak, at the Crown in Fleet-street, between tvvo Temple Gates,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A disputation concerning necessity and contingency of events.
Reproduction of the original in the Christ College Library, Oxford.
